comment.author: 90171649@N00
comment._content:
You wonder how much that single mast, with sails on it, could possibly have added to the propulsion of this giant boat.

Anyone know what all those diagonal things are on the side of the ship?

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: also pictured in last week's set, she has quite an extensive wiki page en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Colossus_(1910) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/90171649@N00] the masts are for spotting, radio antennas etc, no sails would have been used.

comment.author: 36758831@N04
comment._content: commissioned in 1911, Colossus and her sister ship HMS Hercules fought at the Battle of Jutland ,  during which HMS Colossus was slightly damaged. Eventually broken up in 1922. The ships were coal fired, and the masts were not intended for sails, the last British battleship to be equipped with masts intended for a sailing rig, was HMS Inflexible, commissioned in1881. HMS Devastation, commissioned in 1869, was the first British ocean going ironclad to be completed without a sailing rig.
